WorkItem.Description:
Hi,
I'm trying to load the chirpy addin into VS2008, I have altered the Zippy.Addin lines to version 9.0, as indicated in a previous post but I recieve an error when starting Visual Studio 2008.

"The was a problem loading the add-in file 'C:\documents and settings\username\my documents\visual studio 2008\addins\Zippy.Addin'

Error (Line 1):
Switch from current encoding to specified encoding not supported."

I havent found any other users with the same issue in the 'discussions' or 'issues' could you please tell me how to resolve this problem? Can I alter the encoding in the Zippy.Addin line? If so what to? or should I alter a setting somehwere in visual studio?

The add-in has installed correctly (showing up at least) in VS 2010 but I have a 2008 web application, which needs to remain in VS 2008 for support reasons... or I would ditch VS 2008?!?!

Regards,
TB

Comments.Message:
Hi,

Sorry, worked it out...

somehow, no idea how, the Zippy.Addin file was corrupted in VS 2008 Addins folder but not in VS 2010 addins folder. I copied the 2010 versions and changed the version number again and VS2008 loaded successfully...

Please close...

Regards,
TartanBono
